title: Function Declaration & Definition
subject: C Programming
theory:
- **Declaration (Prototype)**: Tells compiler function exists (Name, Return, Params). Top of file. `int foo();`
- **Definition**: Actual code. `int foo() { ... }`
- **Call**: Using it. `foo();`

common_mistakes.correction: Generally safe, but standard is Declare at top -> Main -> Define at bottom.

exam_notes: Compiler needs to know signature before it sees a call.
